The "SUV Market Research Report" by Future Data Stats provides an in-depth examination of the market landscape, utilizing historical data from 2021 to 2023 to identify key trends and growth patterns. Setting 2024 as the foundational year, the report explores consumer behavior, competitive forces, and regulatory frameworks that influence the industry. It transcends basic analysis, delivering a thoroughly researched forecast extending from 2025 to 2033. By employing sophisticated data analysis methodologies, the report not only outlines the market\'s growth trajectory but also uncovers emerging opportunities and foresees potential obstacles, empowering stakeholders with vital insights to adeptly navigate the changing market landscape. Automakers focus on fuel efficiency, advanced safety features, and modern technology to attract buyers. Consumers prefer SUVs for their spacious interiors, high ground clearance, and strong performance across different terrains. The SUV market continues to expand with the introduction of electric and hybrid models, catering to sustainability demands. Rising urbanization and increasing disposable income drive SUV sales globally. Manufacturers innovate with autonomous features and connectivity solutions to enhance user experience and market competitiveness. MARKET DYNAMICS: Manufacturers are integrating advanced technology into SUVs, enhancing safety, connectivity, and performance. The demand for electric and hybrid SUVs continues to grow as consumers seek fuel-efficient and environmentally friendly options. Automakers focus on lightweight materials and aerodynamic designs to improve fuel economy without compromising durability. Luxury SUV models with premium interiors, smart infotainment systems, and autonomous driving features attract a rising number of buyers. Upcoming trends indicate a stronger push toward sustainability, with brands investing in hydrogen-powered and fully electric SUVs. The expansion of online vehicle sales platforms provides consumers with a seamless purchasing experience, increasing digital engagement. Emerging markets are witnessing a surge in SUV demand, driven by improved road infrastructure and rising disposable income. Automakers are also developing compact and urban-friendly SUV models to cater to city dwellers looking for versatile and fuel-efficient vehicles. Rising urbanization and changing lifestyles have led many families to seek vehicles that offer both comfort and functionality. Advancements in technology, such as improved fuel efficiency and enhanced safety features, also attract buyers looking for reliable options. Additionally, the growing popularity of outdoor activities fuels demand for SUVs that can handle diverse terrains and conditions. SUVs have gained popularity due to shifting consumer preferences towards vehicles that offer versatility, space, and a higher driving position. Many consumers perceive SUVs as more practical for various lifestyles, including families, outdoor enthusiasts, and urban commuters. The desire for vehicles capable of accommodating passengers, cargo, and diverse road conditions has driven the demand for SUVs. For Instance, in March 2024, the Peugeot E-5008 made headlines by setting a new standard as the sole all-electric SUV boasting spacious accommodation for up to 7 passengers and an impressive electric range of up to 660 km. Built upon the STLA Medium platform and equipped with a domestically manufactured battery, the E-5008 caters perfectly to the demands of customers seeking a sizable SUV with a bold design, inviting interior, and efficient electric performance. Peugeot ensures complete peace of mind for its clientele by offering the E-5008 with 8 years or 160,000 km coverage through its ALLURE CARE program. Crafted as an electric model from inception, the new E-5008 features a selection of zero-emission motors (WLTP cycles pending approval), ranging from 500 to 660 km in electric range, including an AWD Dual Motor and a Long-Range variant. With advancements in technology, SUVs have become more fuel-efficient compared to their predecessors. Automakers have introduced hybrid and electric SUV models to address environmental concerns and comply with stricter emissions regulations. For instance, in March 2024, BMW unveiled its plan to reveal the Vision Neue Klasse X SUV on March 21st, 2024. This model marks the latest addition to the company's electric SUV lineup, evident from the inclusion of the 'X' designation in its name, signifying its connection to BMW's existing X range of SUVs. The upcoming electric SUV not only represents a glimpse into BMW's forthcoming SUV offerings but also serves as a precursor to its future SUV lineup. Forming a part of BMW's Neue Klasse EV platform , this concept SUV will serve as the foundation for six new vehicles set to debut by 2025. Among these releases is a robust five-seater SUV set to follow in the footsteps of the iX3. Additionally, the perception of SUVs as safer vehicles due to their size and robust construction has contributed to their sustained popularity despite concerns about fuel consumption and emissions. However, despite advancements in fuel efficiency and the emergence of electric SUVs, environmental concerns regarding greenhouse gas emissions and fuel consumption remain significant. Stricter emissions regulations imposed by governments worldwide may limit the appeal of traditional gas-powered SUVs, leading to increased scrutiny and potential restrictions on their sales and usage. SUV Market Trends Expansion of hybrid and plug-in hybrid SUV offerings could emerge as a key factor strengthening the SUV industry. Hybrid and plug-in hybrid SUVs are gaining popularity as a transitional solution for consumers who want improved fuel efficiency without fully committing to electric vehicles. variants, which are offered with two turbo-petrol engine options. Published On Jul 10, 2025 04:21:00 PM 1,06,442 Views Follow us on By Saptarshi Mondal Share - The Mahindra XUV 3XO , formerly XUV300, was launched last year with all-new front and rear designs, a refreshed interior and more features, as well as new powertrain options. Currently priced from Rs 7.99 lakh to Rs 15.79 lakh, ex-showroom India, this Mahindra SUV is available in a total of 12 trim levels (see table below). In this feature, we take a closer look at what features and engine options you get with each trim. Mahindra XUV 3XO petrol variant prices (in Rs, lakh) Petrol-MT Petrol-AT Diesel-MT Diesel-AMT MX1 7.99 - - - RevX M 8.94 - - - RevX M(O) 9.44 - - - MX2 - - 9.99 - MX2 Pro 9.54 10.54 10.64 - MX3 9.74 11.40 10.99 11.79 MX3 Pro 9.99 11.69 11.56 - AX5 11.19 12.69 12.19 12.99 RevX A T-GDI 11.79 12.99 - - AX5L T-GDI 12.62 13.94 - - AX7 T-GDI 12.80 13.99 13.69 14.70 AX7L T-GDI 13.99 15.80 14.99 - Mahindra XUV 3XO variant-wise powertrains The XUV 3XO's engine options include a 111hp, 200Nm, 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine, 131hp, 230Nm, 1.2-litre TGDI engine and 117hp, 300Nm, and 1.5-litre diesel engine.A 6-speed manual gearbox is standard with these engines.Also, both petrol engines get a 6-speed torque converter automatic gearbox, while the diesel XUV 3XO models come with a 6-speed AMT unit. The 111hp turbo-petrol engine is available on the MX1, RevX M, RevX M(O), MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro and the AX5 trims. Moving on, the 131hp turbo-petrol engine is available only on the top four trims - RevX A, AX5 L, AX7 and AX7 L. The diesel engine is available nearly across the board, starting from the fourth-from-base MX2 trim. Here's a look at the variant split of the new XUV 3XO. It is available in five broad variants MX1, MX2, MX3, AX5, and AX7 priced from Rs 7.49 lakh to Rs 15.49 lakh (introductory ex-showroom pan-India). Contents Price of Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants After the Mahindra XUV 3XO features are explained, you must know the price of each variant. In addition, the XUV 3XO comes with a command seating position to offer an exhilarating driving experience. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Dimensions 2. Comforting Interior When you drive the Mahindra XUV 3XO, it elevates your every journey. Stepping inside the XUV 3XOs cabin will let you discover a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. In addition, the sound system lets you experience sonic expanse, and the bass enhancer technology uplifts your mood while driving in crowded areas. As a substantial facelift to its predecessor, the XUV300, the 3XO brings numerous improvements while building on an already solid foundation. This article explores the journey, specifications, features, and impact of this groundbreaking vehicle. Genesis and Evolution The Mahindra XUV 3XO marks a significant evolution in Mahindras compact SUV lineup. Based on the X100 platform shared with the KGM Tivoli, this vehicle follows the successful XUV300 that had established Mahindra as a serious contender in the competitive sub-4-meter SUV segment. The naming convention3XOcleverly represents an evolution and enhancement of the original formula, signifying the vehicles position as more than just a mere facelift. Mahindras decision to refresh the XUV300 came at a critical juncture when competitors were raising the bar with feature-rich offerings. The automotive giant recognized the need to up its game while preserving the core strengths that made the XUV300 popularrobust build quality, powerful engines, and focus on safety. The result is a vehicle that maintains its predecessors DNA while introducing contemporary design elements and cutting-edge technology. Design Philosophy The XUV 3XOs design represents a bold departure from its predecessor while maintaining family resemblance to Mahindras broader SUV lineup. The front fascia commands attention with its striking C-shaped LED daytime running lights (DRLs) and a redesigned grille featuring triangular elements and chrome accents. The LED projector headlamps are neatly integrated into the face, creating a sophisticated and modern appearance. From the side profile, the XUV 3XO carries forward the proportions of the XUV300, with a strong shoulder line and pronounced wheel arches housing stylish 17-inch alloy wheels in top-spec variants. The rear sees a significant update with connected LED taillights and a light bar spanning the tailgatea feature increasingly popular in premium vehicles. The bumpers, both front and rear, have been redesigned to complement the overall aesthetic while enhancing the vehicles stance. Inside, the transformation is even more dramatic. The cabin features a completely redesigned dashboard with premium soft-touch materials and a more contemporary layout. The dual-tone interior scheme adds a touch of sophistication, while the panoramic sunrooflargest in its segmentcreates an airy ambiance. Attention to detail is evident in the redesigned seats with improved bolstering, new upholstery patterns, and ergonomically placed controls. Powertrains and Performance The Mahindra XUV 3XO retains its predecessors reputation for offering robust powertrains, presenting buyers with three engine options to suit different preferences and budgets. The base engine is a 1.2-liter three-cylinder turbocharged petrol unit with port fuel injection (MPFi) that delivers 110 horsepower and 200 Nm of torqueimpressive figures for an entry-level offering. For those seeking more performance, Mahindra offers a higher-tuned version of the 1.2-liter petrol engine with direct injection (TGDi)', 'images': [], 'rank': 4}, {'url': 'https://cargraze.com/blog/2025-mahindra-xuv-3xo-specs-design-performance-and-safety', 'content': '2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety  | Cargraze Home Cars Car Blog Tools Loan EMI Calculator Mileage Calculator Sell Used Car Check RC Login/ Register Home Car Info 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety Published On Dec 24, 2024 By Cargraze for Car Info A Comprehensive Review of the Mahindra XUV 3XO in 2025: Features, Performance, and Value Are you looking for a compact yet powerful vehicle that combines performance, safety, and value in one stunning package? The Mahindra XUV 3XO might be the car youre searching for! Lets dive into a detailed review to see what this model brings in 2025. Design and Exterior Highlights One look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO, especially in black, and its clear that this car is a head-turner. Its sporty design elements stand out with: Chrome Accents: The grille and headlamp finish feature stylish chrome highlights. Projector Headlamps with LED DRLs: These enhance visibility and aesthetics. Diamond-Cut Alloy Wheels: The 16-inch alloys add a premium feel to the vehicle. Safety Ratings: With six airbags and a five-star Global NCAP safety rating, this vehicle excels in safety. Roof Rails & Spoilers: Gloss-black roof rails and a sleek spoiler give it a bold presence on the road. Although the car lacks front parking sensors and certain accessories come as add-ons, its robust styling and road presence more than makes up for these minor drawbacks. Interior Comfort and Technology Step inside the Mahindra XUV 3XO, and youll be greeted by a modern and comfortable cabin: Dual-Tone Dashboard: Soft-touch materials on the doors and satin finishes on the levers add a premium touch. Advanced Infotainment System: A 10.25-inch infotainment display paired with a 10.25-inch digital instrument cluster ensures seamless access to information and entertainment. Steering Controls: A three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel includes controls for cruise and infotainment systems. Comfort Features: From automatic climate control with dual-zone functionality to wireless charging and a vanity mirror with illumination, convenience is a priority. While its disappointing that the glovebox isnt cooled or illuminated, the XUV 3XO compensates with thoughtful features like rear AC vents, adjustable headrests, and ample storage options. Performance and Engine Specifications Under the hood, the Mahindra XUV 3XO packs a punch with its turbocharged petrol engine: Engine Options: It comes with a 1.2-liter three-cylinder MPFI engine, delivering 109 BHP and 200 Nm of torque. Transmission: Choose between manual and automatic transmissions, depending on your driving preference. Fuel Efficiency: Mahindra claims an ARAI-certified mileage of 18.5 km/l, though real-world figures hover around 14-15 km/l. The cars ride quality, stability, and safety features like ABS with EBD, electronic stability control, and tyre pressure monitoring ensure a secure driving experience. Practicality and Storage With a 364-liter boot space, the XUV 3XO offers decent storage capacity. However, operating the boot can feel a bit cumbersome due to its electromagnetic button placement. The spare wheel, tool kit, and first-aid essentials are neatly arranged but require some effort to access. Final Thoughts The Mahindra XUV 3XO is an impressive contender in the compact SUV segment. While it has its minor quirks, the blend of safety, design, and performance makes it a strong value-for-money option in its price range. Would we recommend it? Absolutely! Add it to your shortlist and take it for a spin to see if its the perfect fit for your needs. Dont forget to share your thoughts on this versatile vehicle in the comments section! Mahindra XUV 3XO The Bharat NCAP: What is it and why does it matter? Indias vehicle safety assessment program is Bharat NCAP, Bharat New Car Assessment Program. Being one of the responsible agencies, it examines the safety standards for vehicles being sold in the Indian market. The program performs rigorous crash tests and assessments to give vehicles a safety rating a 5 star rating is the highest rating a vehicle can achieve. What makes Bharat NCAP important is that it lets Indian buyers know the safety potential of the vehicles they buy. It helps manufactures from designing and investing in safety features, this in turn makes roads safer and reduces fatalities in an accident. Lets find out how was the Mahindra XUV 3XO performing in the Bharat NCAP crash test? An Indian automaker has scored a full 5-star safety rating for its vehicle in the Bharat NCAP crash test with the Mahindra XUV 3XO getting a full 5-star safety rating. In adult as well as child occupant protection categories, this compact SUV rendered exemplary performance. The AOP assessment of the XUV 3XO scored an excellent 29.36 points out of a possible 32. This high score is a result of the vehicles strong structure and well designed safety systems that help keep adult occupants safe in most crash scenarios. Additionally, the XUV 3XO did very well for child occupant protection (COP), illustrating the commitment to protect younger passengers. The vehicles position further solidified as a family friendly option offering top notch safety credentials is also affirmed by its exact COP score. How Do Safety Features Earn the XUV 3XO a High Rating? ABS with EBD With various advanced safety features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO has done wonders during the Bharat NCAP crash test. Some of the key safety elements include: Complete occupant protection in all impact scenarios, including six stage airbags. We introduce Electronic Stability Control (ESC), a system to help vehicle stability in difficult driving situations. The above arrives equipped ABS with EBD which performs optimum braking as well as its control. Enhanced to feature ISOFIX child seat anchors for the fast, secure attachment of child safety seats. Front and rear seatbelt reminders to encourage this important safety device. The XUV 3XO was a part of the three SUVs Mahindra sent for the B-NCAP test. Test Results The XUV 3XO received 29.36 out of 32 points for adult occupant protection and 43 out of 49 points for child occupant protection. The Bharat NCAP crash test evaluated the AX7 L and MX2 variants of the XUV 3XO, both of which performed exceptionally well. These features contribute to the vehicles high safety rating and ensure a secure driving experience for occupants. Market Impact This 5-star rating positions the XUV 3XO as one of the safest SUVs in its segment, enhancing Mahindras reputation for producing reliable and secure vehicles. The XUV 3XO competes with the Hyundau Venue, Kia Sonet, Maruti Brezza and others. None of these cars in the segment have scored 5-stars on B-NCAP or G-NCAP Specifications Under the hood, the XUV 3XO comes with a 1.2-liter petrol engine and a 1.2-liter turbocharged petrol engine, both producing 86 bhp and 115 Nm of torque. It also offers a 1.5-liter diesel engine with 115 bhp and 300 Nm of torque. The vehicle features a 6-speed manual transmission and an optional 6-speed automatic gearbox. The XUV 3XO boasts a four-wheel-drive system with a manual shift-on-fly 44 transfer case, making it highly capable for off-road adventures. Heres everything you need to know. Written by Express Drives Desk November 14, 2024 14:30 IST Follow Us Image: Bharat NCAP Bharat NCAP has released the safety crash results of the Mahindra XUV 3X0. The compact SUV secured 5-star rating like its siblings the Thar Roxx and the XUV 400 EV. The XIV 3X0 is the second compact SUV to receive top honours after the Tata Nexon . The XUV 3XO offers 35 standard safety features like six airbags, 3-point seatbelts for all seats, ISOFIX child seat anchors, and a 360-degree surround view system with a Blind View Monitor. The XUV 3XO also features Level 2 ADAS, including Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB), Lane Departure Warning, and Lane Keep Assist along with Electronic Stability Control (ESC) and all four disc brakes. Mahindra XUV 3X0: Adult Occupant Protection Rating The XUV 3X0 is one of the safest compact SUVs in the market and it scored 29.36 out of 32 points. It narrowly missed out on beating its arch-rival, the Tata Nexon, which achieved a shade higher rating with 29.41. The 3X0 scored 13.36 out of 16 in the Frontal Offset Deformable Barrier Test while the Nexon secured 14.65 points. The Mahindra SUV did get the better of the Nexon as the former scored a full 16 points in Side Movable Deformable Barrier Test while the latter managed 14.76. Also Read Mahindra Thar Roxx scores perfect 5-star safety score from Bharat NCAP Mahindra XUV 3X0: Child Occupant Protection Rating The XUV 3X0 received an impressive 43 out of 49 points for Child Occupant Protection missing Nexons ratings by 0.83. While testing the child restraint systems, the 3X0 scored a full 24 points in Dynamic Score, a full 12 points in CRS installation and 7 out 13 in Vehicle Assessment Score. Just for reference, the Nexon, on the other hand, managed 22.83 in Dynamic Score, top marks in CRS installation and 9 in Vehicle Assessment Score, which is two points more than the 3X0. Car Comparison Bike Comparison Tech News More Search Search Home Car News Mahindra XUV 3XO scores 5 stars in Bharat NCAP crash tests Read along to view the test results. Utkarsh Joshi November 14, 2024 Share Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Linkedin ReddIt Email Print Telegram Advertisment Mahindra XUV 3XO has secured a 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP. The SUV was crash-tested by Bharat NCAP in October 2024. This safety rating applies to all variants of the SUV. The 3XO was launched in India in April 2024. Since then, the compact SUV has gained a lot of popularity in the country. The Mahindra Thar Roxx and XUV400 SUVs were also tested by BNCAP and awarded a 5-star rating. Read Also: Buyers face waiting periods of up to 3 months for Tata Curvv Table of Contents - Advertisement - Toggle Mahindra XUV 3XO: Bharat NCAP test results explained Conclusion Mahindra XUV 3XO: Bharat NCAP test results explained Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 29.36 points out of a possible 32 in the Adult Occupants Protection (AOP) test. In the frontal offset deformable test, the SUV offered good protection to the drivers and passengers head, neck, and abdomen. The drivers chest and right leg showed adequate protection while the left leg showed marginal protection. The passengers chest and legs were well protected. In the side movable deformable barrier test and side pole impact test, the SUV offered good protection to the head, chest, and abdomen. Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 43 points out of a possible 49 in the Child Occupant Protection (COP) test. It got a Dynamic score of 24 points (max. 24), a CRS installation score of 12 points (max. 12), and a Vehicle assessment score of 7 points (max. 13). The SUV was crash tested using test dummies for 18-month-old and 3-year-old children. Mahindra XUV 3XO is packed with 35 standard safety features. It features 6 airbags, 3-point seatbelts for all passengers, ISOFIX child seat anchorages, a 360-degree camera, a Blind View Monitor and more. The SUV is also equipped with a Level 2 ADAS package with features like Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB), Lane Departure Warning, and Lane Keep Assist. R Velusamy, President, Automotive Technology and Product Development, Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. , said, At Mahindra, safety has always been at the core of our product development, and we have trailblazed our way to achieving the highest safety standards on Indian roads. The 5-star Bharat-NCAP ratings for the Thar ROXX, XUV 3XO, and XUV400 reaffirm our mission to create world-class SUVs that offer both outstanding performance and unmatched safety. From pioneering the introduction of six airbags in 2011 to now leading the charge with multiple 5-star-rated vehicles, we continue to set new benchmarks for safety across all segments. As Indias safety norms evolve, Mahindra will continue to push the envelope, ensuring highest safety standards for its SUVs. AUTO PUNDITZ January 2025 Mahindra Sales Analysis YoY, MoM Change, 6-Month Trend V3Cars Feb 20 5 min read In this January 2025 Mahindra car sales analysis, well look at the car sales of Mahindra for the previous month. Well also compare the YoY and MoM change to find out which Mahindra cars sales improved and which ones declined. To support the trends, well also provide our opinions where applicable. Lastly, the table with monthly sales for the last 6 months will give you an idea about the 6-month sales trend of all Mahindra cars. Gunning For The 2nd Spot While their usual sales heroes like the Scorpio and XUV700 have been performing well for several years now, the 3XO along with some help from Thar Roxx, Mahindra are shaking up the auto industry. And this behaviour isnt going to change. With the BE6 and XEV 9e, they have conveyed that theyre not just here to sell electric cars. Theyre here to set new benchmarks in terms of value and features. The pricing of these 2 EVs has shaken up not just carmakers like Hyundai, Tata and Maruti but also the Chinese/Chinese-owned carmakers like MG and BYD are feeling the sting. So much so that MG jacked up the prices of the ZS while leaving the base price unchanged. On top of that, they are willing to give away discounts of up to ~Rs. 2.50 lakh on the base trim, which is the highest we have ever seen. So, the price hike was just a smoke screen when in reality, they are feeling the pinch from Mahindras BE6 and the Tata Curvv EV. We were counting on having a price war in the EV space in the 2025 - 28 period but a non-Chinese carmaker would take the first swing that, we didnt expect. The first swing will come from an Indian carmaker, that didnt just come as a surprise, it came as a shock. Its not this move that should scare the Chinese and even other carmakers. Its their attitude and hunger for greater market share, which should scare their rivals. The EV strategy suggests that this time around, they arent just going for one more bite out of the pie. They want the whole pie to themselves. Of course, it's not going to be easy but it looks like they are gunning for it anyway. That should make Hyundai very worried as they have maintained their hold on the 2nd spot in the Indian car market for God knows how long. Carmaker Jan 2025 Jan 2024 YoY% 12M Avg Maruti 1,73,599 1,66,802 +4.07% 1,46,850 Hyundai 54,003 57,013 -5.28% 50,193 Mahindra 50,659 43,068 +17.63% 44,950 Tata 48,075 53,635 -10.37% 46,409 Compared to Jan 2024, Mahindra and Maruti have gained market share while Hyundai and Tata have lost. Mahindra's YoY gains of 17.63% come across as enormous compared to Marutis. However, the YoY decline of 10.37% in Tatas sales suggests that they have graduated from 4th spot to 3rd. Since Hyundai also appear to have suffered some YoY decline in Jan 2025, its not too far-fetched to imagine that once Mahindra are feeling secure in the 3rd spot, they will be preparing to displace Hyundai from the 2nd spot. In average sales, though, Hyundai remain firmly in the 2nd spot while Tata in 3rd spot. Mahindra are in the 4th spot with an average shortage of 1459 every month. We expect them to easily make up this gap and create a larger gap for Tata to crawl in this calendar year. For 2025, Tata are also lining up the Sierra petrol/diesel and Sierra EV along with the Harrier EV. Mahindra XUV 3XO Report

Executive Summary

Overview.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compact SUV competing in a rapidly evolving market. This report analyzes the SUV segment, focusing on market dynamics, key features of the XUV 3XO, safety and luxury aspects, and sales performance. The SUV market is projected to reach $3.71 billion by 2033, with a CAGR of 2.5% from 2025. The XUV 3XO stands out with its design, features, and a recent 5-star Bharat NCAP safety rating. Sales data indicates a fluctuating trend with recent figures around 7,000 units per month.

This section provides an overview of the report's scope and key findings. It summarizes the market context and highlights the unique aspects of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • SUV market projected to reach $3.71B by 2033 with 2.5% CAGR.
  • Mahindra XUV 3XO: Key player in the compact SUV segment.
  • 5-star Bharat NCAP safety rating enhances market position.
  • Monthly sales around 7,000 units; fluctuating trends observed.

Mahindra XUV 3XO Features and Specifications.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants, including MX1, MX2, MX3, AX5, and AX7. Engine options include a 1.2L turbo-petrol, a 1.2L TGDi petrol, and a 1.5L diesel. The vehicle boasts features such as LED DRLs, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and Level 2 ADAS in higher variants. Safety features include 6 airbags and ESC.

This section details the specifications, variants, and key features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • Multiple variants: MX1, MX2, MX3, AX5, AX7.
  • Engine options: 1.2L turbo-petrol, 1.2L TGDi petrol, 1.5L diesel.
  • Features: LED DRLs, 10.25-inch touchscreen, Level 2 ADAS.
  • Safety: 6 airbags, ESC.
Variant Engine Key Features
MX1 1.2L Turbo Petrol 6 Airbags, ESC, Halogen Headlamps
MX2 1.5L Diesel 10.25-inch Touchscreen, Steering Controls
AX7 1.2L TGDi Petrol Level 2 ADAS, Skyroof, Premium Interiors

Safety Analysis.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has achieved a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests. It offers 35 standard safety features, including six airbags, ESC, ISOFIX child seat anchors, and a 360-degree camera. The vehicle scored 29.36 out of 32 in Adult Occupant Protection and 43 out of 49 in Child Occupant Protection.

This section presents a detailed analysis of the XUV 3XO's safety features and crash test performance.

  • 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP.
  • 35 standard safety features.
  • AOP: 29.36/32.
  • COP: 43/49.

Luxury Features and Comfort.

The XUV 3XO offers premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox, and a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system. It also features a panoramic sunroof (Skyroof) and smart connectivity with Amazon Alexa integration. These features provide a blend of comfort and technology.

This section details the luxury and comfort features available in the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • Premium leatherette seats
  • Cooled glovebox with illumination
  • Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system
  • Panoramic sunroof (Skyroof)
  • Smart connectivity with Amazon Alexa

Sales Data and Market Trends.

Mahindra XUV 3XO sales have shown some fluctuations, with recent monthly sales around 7,000 units. The SUV has contributed significantly to Mahindra's overall sales figures. Year-on-year growth has been observed in certain months, while month-on-month figures show variability.

This section analyzes the sales performance and market trends of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • Monthly sales around 7,000 units.
  • Year-on-year growth observed.
  • Fluctuating month-on-month sales.
  • Key contributor to Mahindra's sales.

Competitor Comparison.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO competes with models like Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, and Maruti Brezza. The XUV 3XO distinguishes itself with its blend of safety ratings, feature offerings, and engine options. In comparison, Tata Nexon offer slightly higher rating in AOP, but XUV 3XO offered the same level safety.

This section compares the Mahindra XUV 3XO with its key competitors in the compact SUV segment.

  • Competitors: Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Maruti Brezza
  • Key differentiators: Safety ratings, features, engine options
  • Strengths: Balance of safety and features
  • Compared to Tata Nexon, slightly lower AOP

Pune Hyderabad Ahmedabad Chennai Kolkata Home Features Mahindra XUV 3XO price, variants, features explained Mahindra XUV 3XO price, variants, features explained The XUV 3XO recently added new RevX variants, which are offered with two turbo-petrol engine options. Published On Jul 10, 2025 04:21:00 PM 1,06,442 Views Follow us on By Saptarshi Mondal Share - The Mahindra XUV 3XO , formerly XUV300, was launched last year with all-new front and rear designs, a refreshed interior and more features, as well as new powertrain options. Currently priced from Rs 7.99 lakh to Rs 15.79 lakh, ex-showroom India, this Mahindra SUV is available in a total of 12 trim levels (see table below). In this feature, we take a closer look at what features and engine options you get with each trim. Mahindra XUV 3XO petrol variant prices (in Rs, lakh) Petrol-MT Petrol-AT Diesel-MT Diesel-AMT MX1 7.99 - - - RevX M 8.94 - - - RevX M(O) 9.44 - - - MX2 - - 9.99 - MX2 Pro 9.54 10.54 10.64 - MX3 9.74 11.40 10.99 11.79 MX3 Pro 9.99 11.69 11.56 - AX5 11.19 12.69 12.19 12.99 RevX A T-GDI 11.79 12.99 - - AX5L T-GDI 12.62 13.94 - - AX7 T-GDI 12.80 13.99 13.69 14.70 AX7L T-GDI 13.99 15.80 14.99 - Mahindra XUV 3XO variant-wise powertrains The XUV 3XO's engine options include a 111hp, 200Nm, 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine, 131hp, 230Nm, 1.2-litre TGDI engine and 117hp, 300Nm, and 1.5-litre diesel engine.A 6-speed manual gearbox is standard with these engines.Also, both petrol engines get a 6-speed torque converter automatic gearbox, while the diesel XUV 3XO models come with a 6-speed AMT unit. The 111hp turbo-petrol engine is available on the MX1, RevX M, RevX M(O), MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro and the AX5 trims. Moving on, the 131hp turbo-petrol engine is available only on the top four trims - RevX A, AX5 L, AX7 and AX7 L. The diesel engine is available nearly across the board, starting from the fourth-from-base MX2 trim. Here's a look at the variant split of the new XUV 3XO. Modified On Jun 13, 2024 10:29 AM By Rohit 9.8K Views Write a comment The new XUV 3XO is sold in five broad variants: MX1, MX2, MX3, AX5, and AX7 The Mahindra XUV300 was introduced in a facelifted avatar in late April 2024, with the new XUV 3XO nameplate. It is available in five broad variants MX1, MX2, MX3, AX5, and AX7 priced from Rs 7.49 lakh to Rs 15.49 lakh (introductory ex-showroom pan-India). Published On Jul 10, 2025 04:21:00 PM 1,06,442 Views Follow us on By Saptarshi Mondal Share - The Mahindra XUV 3XO , formerly XUV300, was launched last year with all-new front and rear designs, a refreshed interior and more features, as well as new powertrain options. Currently priced from Rs 7.99 lakh to Rs 15.79 lakh, ex-showroom India, this Mahindra SUV is available in a total of 12 trim levels (see table below). In this feature, we take a closer look at what features and engine options you get with each trim. Mahindra XUV 3XO petrol variant prices (in Rs, lakh) Petrol-MT Petrol-AT Diesel-MT Diesel-AMT MX1 7.99 - - - RevX M 8.94 - - - RevX M(O) 9.44 - - - MX2 - - 9.99 - MX2 Pro 9.54 10.54 10.64 - MX3 9.74 11.40 10.99 11.79 MX3 Pro 9.99 11.69 11.56 - AX5 11.19 12.69 12.19 12.99 RevX A T-GDI 11.79 12.99 - - AX5L T-GDI 12.62 13.94 - - AX7 T-GDI 12.80 13.99 13.69 14.70 AX7L T-GDI 13.99 15.80 14.99 - Mahindra XUV 3XO variant-wise powertrains The XUV 3XO's engine options include a 111hp, 200Nm, 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine, 131hp, 230Nm, 1.2-litre TGDI engine and 117hp, 300Nm, and 1.5-litre diesel engine.A 6-speed manual gearbox is standard with these engines.Also, both petrol engines get a 6-speed torque converter automatic gearbox, while the diesel XUV 3XO models come with a 6-speed AMT unit. The 111hp turbo-petrol engine is available on the MX1, RevX M, RevX M(O), MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro and the AX5 trims. Moving on, the 131hp turbo-petrol engine is available only on the top four trims - RevX A, AX5 L, AX7 and AX7 L. The diesel engine is available nearly across the board, starting from the fourth-from-base MX2 trim. Here's a look at the variant split of the new XUV 3XO. It can wade through water up to 350 mm deep, showcasing its capability for mild off-roading adventures. As a substantial facelift to its predecessor, the XUV300, the 3XO brings numerous improvements while building on an already solid foundation. This article explores the journey, specifications, features, and impact of this groundbreaking vehicle. Genesis and Evolution The Mahindra XUV 3XO marks a significant evolution in Mahindras compact SUV lineup. Based on the X100 platform shared with the KGM Tivoli, this vehicle follows the successful XUV300 that had established Mahindra as a serious contender in the competitive sub-4-meter SUV segment. The naming convention3XOcleverly represents an evolution and enhancement of the original formula, signifying the vehicles position as more than just a mere facelift. Mahindras decision to refresh the XUV300 came at a critical juncture when competitors were raising the bar with feature-rich offerings. The automotive giant recognized the need to up its game while preserving the core strengths that made the XUV300 popularrobust build quality, powerful engines, and focus on safety. The result is a vehicle that maintains its predecessors DNA while introducing contemporary design elements and cutting-edge technology. Design Philosophy The XUV 3XOs design represents a bold departure from its predecessor while maintaining family resemblance to Mahindras broader SUV lineup. The front fascia commands attention with its striking C-shaped LED daytime running lights (DRLs) and a redesigned grille featuring triangular elements and chrome accents. The LED projector headlamps are neatly integrated into the face, creating a sophisticated and modern appearance. From the side profile, the XUV 3XO carries forward the proportions of the XUV300, with a strong shoulder line and pronounced wheel arches housing stylish 17-inch alloy wheels in top-spec variants. The rear sees a significant update with connected LED taillights and a light bar spanning the tailgatea feature increasingly popular in premium vehicles. The bumpers, both front and rear, have been redesigned to complement the overall aesthetic while enhancing the vehicles stance. Inside, the transformation is even more dramatic. The cabin features a completely redesigned dashboard with premium soft-touch materials and a more contemporary layout. The dual-tone interior scheme adds a touch of sophistication, while the panoramic sunrooflargest in its segmentcreates an airy ambiance. Attention to detail is evident in the redesigned seats with improved bolstering, new upholstery patterns, and ergonomically placed controls. Powertrains and Performance The Mahindra XUV 3XO retains its predecessors reputation for offering robust powertrains, presenting buyers with three engine options to suit different preferences and budgets. The base engine is a 1.2-liter three-cylinder turbocharged petrol unit with port fuel injection (MPFi) that delivers 110 horsepower and 200 Nm of torqueimpressive figures for an entry-level offering. For those seeking more performance, Mahindra offers a higher-tuned version of the 1.2-liter petrol engine with direct injection (TGDi)', 'images': [], 'rank': 4}, {'url': 'https://cargraze.com/blog/2025-mahindra-xuv-3xo-specs-design-performance-and-safety', 'content': '2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety  | Cargraze Home Cars Car Blog Tools Loan EMI Calculator Mileage Calculator Sell Used Car Check RC Login/ Register Home Car Info 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety Published On Dec 24, 2024 By Cargraze for Car Info A Comprehensive Review of the Mahindra XUV 3XO in 2025: Features, Performance, and Value Are you looking for a compact yet powerful vehicle that combines performance, safety, and value in one stunning package? The Mahindra XUV 3XO might be the car youre searching for! Lets dive into a detailed review to see what this model brings in 2025. Design and Exterior Highlights One look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO, especially in black, and its clear that this car is a head-turner. Its sporty design elements stand out with: Chrome Accents: The grille and headlamp finish feature stylish chrome highlights. Projector Headlamps with LED DRLs: These enhance visibility and aesthetics. Diamond-Cut Alloy Wheels: The 16-inch alloys add a premium feel to the vehicle. Safety Ratings: With six airbags and a five-star Global NCAP safety rating, this vehicle excels in safety. Roof Rails & Spoilers: Gloss-black roof rails and a sleek spoiler give it a bold presence on the road. Although the car lacks front parking sensors and certain accessories come as add-ons, its robust styling and road presence more than makes up for these minor drawbacks. Interior Comfort and Technology Step inside the Mahindra XUV 3XO, and youll be greeted by a modern and comfortable cabin: Dual-Tone Dashboard: Soft-touch materials on the doors and satin finishes on the levers add a premium touch. Advanced Infotainment System: A 10.25-inch infotainment display paired with a 10.25-inch digital instrument cluster ensures seamless access to information and entertainment. Steering Controls: A three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel includes controls for cruise and infotainment systems. Comfort Features: From automatic climate control with dual-zone functionality to wireless charging and a vanity mirror with illumination, convenience is a priority. While its disappointing that the glovebox isnt cooled or illuminated, the XUV 3XO compensates with thoughtful features like rear AC vents, adjustable headrests, and ample storage options. Performance and Engine Specifications Under the hood, the Mahindra XUV 3XO packs a punch with its turbocharged petrol engine: Engine Options: It comes with a 1.2-liter three-cylinder MPFI engine, delivering 109 BHP and 200 Nm of torque. Transmission: Choose between manual and automatic transmissions, depending on your driving preference. Fuel Efficiency: Mahindra claims an ARAI-certified mileage of 18.5 km/l, though real-world figures hover around 14-15 km/l. The cars ride quality, stability, and safety features like ABS with EBD, electronic stability control, and tyre pressure monitoring ensure a secure driving experience. Practicality and Storage With a 364-liter boot space, the XUV 3XO offers decent storage capacity. However, operating the boot can feel a bit cumbersome due to its electromagnetic button placement. The spare wheel, tool kit, and first-aid essentials are neatly arranged but require some effort to access. Final Thoughts The Mahindra XUV 3XO is an impressive contender in the compact SUV segment. While it has its minor quirks, the blend of safety, design, and performance makes it a strong value-for-money option in its price range. Would we recommend it? Absolutely! Add it to your shortlist and take it for a spin to see if its the perfect fit for your needs. Dont forget to share your thoughts on this versatile vehicle in the comments section! output.initial_thoughts: I need to conduct a detailed analysis of the safety features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, including active and passive safety systems, crash test ratings, and driver assistance technologies. The data should be presented in a format that allows for easy comparison with safety standards and other vehicles in its class, and should be suitable for generating charts. Rating In Bharat NCAP Crash Test Cars Mahindra November 19, 2024 By Sukhmandeep K 8 months ago 91 7 minutes read In the automotive world, the Mahindra XUV 3XO, has become a driving force in vehicle safety. In this article we dive into the revolutionary performance of the XUV 3XO in the Bharat NCAP crash test and discuss what the implications of it could mean for the Indian automotive space as well as the other key players vying for the Bharat NCAP crown. Whether youre a car enthusiast, safety minded consumer, or simply interested in the state of the art among Indias vehicle safety technology, this analysis will offer you some valuable insight into Indias auto market as it looks out onto the road ahead. Mahindra XUV 3XO The Bharat NCAP: What is it and why does it matter? Indias vehicle safety assessment program is Bharat NCAP, Bharat New Car Assessment Program. Being one of the responsible agencies, it examines the safety standards for vehicles being sold in the Indian market. The program performs rigorous crash tests and assessments to give vehicles a safety rating a 5 star rating is the highest rating a vehicle can achieve. What makes Bharat NCAP important is that it lets Indian buyers know the safety potential of the vehicles they buy. It helps manufactures from designing and investing in safety features, this in turn makes roads safer and reduces fatalities in an accident. Lets find out how was the Mahindra XUV 3XO performing in the Bharat NCAP crash test? An Indian automaker has scored a full 5-star safety rating for its vehicle in the Bharat NCAP crash test with the Mahindra XUV 3XO getting a full 5-star safety rating. In adult as well as child occupant protection categories, this compact SUV rendered exemplary performance. The AOP assessment of the XUV 3XO scored an excellent 29.36 points out of a possible 32. This high score is a result of the vehicles strong structure and well designed safety systems that help keep adult occupants safe in most crash scenarios. Additionally, the XUV 3XO did very well for child occupant protection (COP), illustrating the commitment to protect younger passengers. The vehicles position further solidified as a family friendly option offering top notch safety credentials is also affirmed by its exact COP score. How Do Safety Features Earn the XUV 3XO a High Rating? ABS with EBD With various advanced safety features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO has done wonders during the Bharat NCAP crash test. Some of the key safety elements include: Complete occupant protection in all impact scenarios, including six stage airbags. We introduce Electronic Stability Control (ESC), a system to help vehicle stability in difficult driving situations. The above arrives equipped ABS with EBD which performs optimum braking as well as its control. Enhanced to feature ISOFIX child seat anchors for the fast, secure attachment of child safety seats. Front and rear seatbelt reminders to encourage this important safety device. You May Like: Mahindra Thar Drops 8 Convertible Variants Moreover, the body structure of the XUV 3XO is also robust enough to mean it absorbs and disperses crash energy well, thus contributing to occupant protection. XUV 3XO: A 5Star Rated SUV Comparison with other similar Vehicles in India With Bharat NCAP crash test 5 star safety rated, the Mahindra XUV 3XO enters an illustrious club of cars to become a part of; the only auto maker to do so. The XUV 3XO was a part of the three SUVs Mahindra sent for the B-NCAP test. Test Results The XUV 3XO received 29.36 out of 32 points for adult occupant protection and 43 out of 49 points for child occupant protection. The Bharat NCAP crash test evaluated the AX7 L and MX2 variants of the XUV 3XO, both of which performed exceptionally well. Safety Features The XUV 3XO is equipped with a range of advanced safety features, including six airbags, 3-point seatbelts for all seats, ISOFIX child seat anchors, and a 360-degree surround view system with blind view monitor. Additionally, it comes with Electronic Stability Control (ESC), seatbelt reminders, and pre-tensioners with load limiters. These features contribute to the vehicles high safety rating and ensure a secure driving experience for occupants. Market Impact This 5-star rating positions the XUV 3XO as one of the safest SUVs in its segment, enhancing Mahindras reputation for producing reliable and secure vehicles. The XUV 3XO competes with the Hyundau Venue, Kia Sonet, Maruti Brezza and others. None of these cars in the segment have scored 5-stars on B-NCAP or G-NCAP Specifications Under the hood, the XUV 3XO comes with a 1.2-liter petrol engine and a 1.2-liter turbocharged petrol engine, both producing 86 bhp and 115 Nm of torque. It also offers a 1.5-liter diesel engine with 115 bhp and 300 Nm of torque. The vehicle features a 6-speed manual transmission and an optional 6-speed automatic gearbox. The XUV 3XO boasts a four-wheel-drive system with a manual shift-on-fly 44 transfer case, making it highly capable for off-road adventures. Heres everything you need to know. Written by Express Drives Desk November 14, 2024 14:30 IST Follow Us Image: Bharat NCAP Bharat NCAP has released the safety crash results of the Mahindra XUV 3X0. The compact SUV secured 5-star rating like its siblings the Thar Roxx and the XUV 400 EV. The XIV 3X0 is the second compact SUV to receive top honours after the Tata Nexon . The XUV 3XO offers 35 standard safety features like six airbags, 3-point seatbelts for all seats, ISOFIX child seat anchors, and a 360-degree surround view system with a Blind View Monitor. The XUV 3XO also features Level 2 ADAS, including Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB), Lane Departure Warning, and Lane Keep Assist along with Electronic Stability Control (ESC) and all four disc brakes. Mahindra XUV 3X0: Adult Occupant Protection Rating The XUV 3X0 is one of the safest compact SUVs in the market and it scored 29.36 out of 32 points. It narrowly missed out on beating its arch-rival, the Tata Nexon, which achieved a shade higher rating with 29.41. The 3X0 scored 13.36 out of 16 in the Frontal Offset Deformable Barrier Test while the Nexon secured 14.65 points. The Mahindra SUV did get the better of the Nexon as the former scored a full 16 points in Side Movable Deformable Barrier Test while the latter managed 14.76. Also Read Mahindra Thar Roxx scores perfect 5-star safety score from Bharat NCAP Mahindra XUV 3X0: Child Occupant Protection Rating The XUV 3X0 received an impressive 43 out of 49 points for Child Occupant Protection missing Nexons ratings by 0.83. While testing the child restraint systems, the 3X0 scored a full 24 points in Dynamic Score, a full 12 points in CRS installation and 7 out 13 in Vehicle Assessment Score. Just for reference, the Nexon, on the other hand, managed 22.83 in Dynamic Score, top marks in CRS installation and 9 in Vehicle Assessment Score, which is two points more than the 3X0. Car Comparison Bike Comparison Tech News More Search Search Home Car News Mahindra XUV 3XO scores 5 stars in Bharat NCAP crash tests Read along to view the test results. Utkarsh Joshi November 14, 2024 Share Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Linkedin ReddIt Email Print Telegram Advertisment Mahindra XUV 3XO has secured a 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP. The SUV was crash-tested by Bharat NCAP in October 2024. This safety rating applies to all variants of the SUV. The 3XO was launched in India in April 2024. Since then, the compact SUV has gained a lot of popularity in the country. The Mahindra Thar Roxx and XUV400 SUVs were also tested by BNCAP and awarded a 5-star rating. Read Also: Buyers face waiting periods of up to 3 months for Tata Curvv Table of Contents - Advertisement - Toggle Mahindra XUV 3XO: Bharat NCAP test results explained Conclusion Mahindra XUV 3XO: Bharat NCAP test results explained Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 29.36 points out of a possible 32 in the Adult Occupants Protection (AOP) test. In the frontal offset deformable test, the SUV offered good protection to the drivers and passengers head, neck, and abdomen. The drivers chest and right leg showed adequate protection while the left leg showed marginal protection. The passengers chest and legs were well protected. In the side movable deformable barrier test and side pole impact test, the SUV offered good protection to the head, chest, and abdomen. Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 43 points out of a possible 49 in the Child Occupant Protection (COP) test. It got a Dynamic score of 24 points (max. 24), a CRS installation score of 12 points (max. 12), and a Vehicle assessment score of 7 points (max. 13). The SUV is also equipped with a Level 2 ADAS package with features like Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB), Lane Departure Warning, and Lane Keep Assist. R Velusamy, President, Automotive Technology and Product Development, Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. , said, At Mahindra, safety has always been at the core of our product development, and we have trailblazed our way to achieving the highest safety standards on Indian roads. From pioneering the introduction of six airbags in 2011 to now leading the charge with multiple 5-star-rated vehicles, we continue to set new benchmarks for safety across all segments. As Indias safety norms evolve, Mahindra will continue to push the envelope, ensuring highest safety standards for its SUVs. Mahindra XUV 3XO The Bharat NCAP: What is it and why does it matter? Indias vehicle safety assessment program is Bharat NCAP, Bharat New Car Assessment Program. Being one of the responsible agencies, it examines the safety standards for vehicles being sold in the Indian market. The program performs rigorous crash tests and assessments to give vehicles a safety rating a 5 star rating is the highest rating a vehicle can achieve. What makes Bharat NCAP important is that it lets Indian buyers know the safety potential of the vehicles they buy. It helps manufactures from designing and investing in safety features, this in turn makes roads safer and reduces fatalities in an accident. Lets find out how was the Mahindra XUV 3XO performing in the Bharat NCAP crash test? An Indian automaker has scored a full 5-star safety rating for its vehicle in the Bharat NCAP crash test with the Mahindra XUV 3XO getting a full 5-star safety rating. In adult as well as child occupant protection categories, this compact SUV rendered exemplary performance. The AOP assessment of the XUV 3XO scored an excellent 29.36 points out of a possible 32. This high score is a result of the vehicles strong structure and well designed safety systems that help keep adult occupants safe in most crash scenarios. Additionally, the XUV 3XO did very well for child occupant protection (COP), illustrating the commitment to protect younger passengers. The vehicles position further solidified as a family friendly option offering top notch safety credentials is also affirmed by its exact COP score. How Do Safety Features Earn the XUV 3XO a High Rating? ABS with EBD With various advanced safety features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO has done wonders during the Bharat NCAP crash test. Some of the key safety elements include: Complete occupant protection in all impact scenarios, including six stage airbags. We introduce Electronic Stability Control (ESC), a system to help vehicle stability in difficult driving situations. The above arrives equipped ABS with EBD which performs optimum braking as well as its control. Enhanced to feature ISOFIX child seat anchors for the fast, secure attachment of child safety seats. Front and rear seatbelt reminders to encourage this important safety device. In the frontal offset deformable test, the SUV offered good protection to the drivers and passengers head, neck, and abdomen. The drivers chest and right leg showed adequate protection while the left leg showed marginal protection. The passengers chest and legs were well protected. AUTO PUNDITZ January 2025 Mahindra Sales Analysis YoY, MoM Change, 6-Month Trend V3Cars Feb 20 5 min read In this January 2025 Mahindra car sales analysis, well look at the car sales of Mahindra for the previous month. Well also compare the YoY and MoM change to find out which Mahindra cars sales improved and which ones declined. To support the trends, well also provide our opinions where applicable. Lastly, the table with monthly sales for the last 6 months will give you an idea about the 6-month sales trend of all Mahindra cars. Gunning For The 2nd Spot While their usual sales heroes like the Scorpio and XUV700 have been performing well for several years now, the 3XO along with some help from Thar Roxx, Mahindra are shaking up the auto industry. And this behaviour isnt going to change. With the BE6 and XEV 9e, they have conveyed that theyre not just here to sell electric cars. Theyre here to set new benchmarks in terms of value and features. The pricing of these 2 EVs has shaken up not just carmakers like Hyundai, Tata and Maruti but also the Chinese/Chinese-owned carmakers like MG and BYD are feeling the sting. So much so that MG jacked up the prices of the ZS while leaving the base price unchanged. On top of that, they are willing to give away discounts of up to ~Rs. 2.50 lakh on the base trim, which is the highest we have ever seen. So, the price hike was just a smoke screen when in reality, they are feeling the pinch from Mahindras BE6 and the Tata Curvv EV. We were counting on having a price war in the EV space in the 2025 - 28 period but a non-Chinese carmaker would take the first swing that, we didnt expect. The first swing will come from an Indian carmaker, that didnt just come as a surprise, it came as a shock. Its not this move that should scare the Chinese and even other carmakers. Its their attitude and hunger for greater market share, which should scare their rivals. The EV strategy suggests that this time around, they arent just going for one more bite out of the pie. They want the whole pie to themselves. Of course, it's not going to be easy but it looks like they are gunning for it anyway. That should make Hyundai very worried as they have maintained their hold on the 2nd spot in the Indian car market for God knows how long. Carmaker Jan 2025 Jan 2024 YoY% 12M Avg Maruti 1,73,599 1,66,802 +4.07% 1,46,850 Hyundai 54,003 57,013 -5.28% 50,193 Mahindra 50,659 43,068 +17.63% 44,950 Tata 48,075 53,635 -10.37% 46,409 Compared to Jan 2024, Mahindra and Maruti have gained market share while Hyundai and Tata have lost. Mahindra's YoY gains of 17.63% come across as enormous compared to Marutis. However, the YoY decline of 10.37% in Tatas sales suggests that they have graduated from 4th spot to 3rd. Since Hyundai also appear to have suffered some YoY decline in Jan 2025, its not too far-fetched to imagine that once Mahindra are feeling secure in the 3rd spot, they will be preparing to displace Hyundai from the 2nd spot. In average sales, though, Hyundai remain firmly in the 2nd spot while Tata in 3rd spot. Mahindra are in the 4th spot with an average shortage of 1459 every month. We expect them to easily make up this gap and create a larger gap for Tata to crawl in this calendar year. For 2025, Tata are also lining up the Sierra petrol/diesel and Sierra EV along with the Harrier EV. The response was remarkable, as the automaker received over 50,000 bookings within just an hour of opening reservations. Interestingly, nearly 70 per cent of the bookings were for the petrol variants of this compact SUV. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has been a key contributor to the brands sales figures since its debut. In its first month on sale in May 2024, 10,000 units were dispatched. The compact SUV has maintained this momentum over the following months, with August 2024 seeing a strong performance of 9,000 units, nearly doubling the 4,992 units sold in the same month last year. This resulted in a significant year-on-year sales growth of 80 per cent for the Mahindra XUV 3XO. However, MoM figures showed a 10 per cent decline, as 10,000 units were sold in July 2024. The XUV 3XO is available in nine trim levels namely MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro, AX5, AX5 Luxury, AX7, and AX7 Luxury. Although the MX3 Pro offers excellent value for money, the feature-packed AX5 and AX5 Luxury variants remain popular choices among buyers. Also Read:Mahindra XUV 3XO Most Detailed Review & Mileage Test Consumers tend to favour the petrol variants over the diesel versions of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, primarily due to the notable price gap between the two fuel options. The compact SUV is offered with three engine choices: a 1.2L petrol, a 1.2L direct injection petrol and a 1.5L diesel. The 1.2L petrol engine produces 115 PS and 200 Nm of torque while the more powerful 1.2L DI variant delivers 130 PS and 250 Nm of torque. The 1.5L four-cylinder diesel engine in the Mahindra XUV 3XO generates 117 PS and 300 Nm of torque. Transmission options include a six-speed manual, a six-speed AMT and a six-speed TC. Compared to its predecessor, the rebranded XUV 3XO boasts a larger boot, enhancing its practicality. AUTO PUNDITZ January 2025 Mahindra Sales Analysis YoY, MoM Change, 6-Month Trend V3Cars Feb 20 5 min read In this January 2025 Mahindra car sales analysis, well look at the car sales of Mahindra for the previous month. Well also compare the YoY and MoM change to find out which Mahindra cars sales improved and which ones declined. To support the trends, well also provide our opinions where applicable. Lastly, the table with monthly sales for the last 6 months will give you an idea about the 6-month sales trend of all Mahindra cars. Gunning For The 2nd Spot While their usual sales heroes like the Scorpio and XUV700 have been performing well for several years now, the 3XO along with some help from Thar Roxx, Mahindra are shaking up the auto industry. And this behaviour isnt going to change. With the BE6 and XEV 9e, they have conveyed that theyre not just here to sell electric cars. Theyre here to set new benchmarks in terms of value and features. The pricing of these 2 EVs has shaken up not just carmakers like Hyundai, Tata and Maruti but also the Chinese/Chinese-owned carmakers like MG and BYD are feeling the sting. So much so that MG jacked up the prices of the ZS while leaving the base price unchanged. On top of that, they are willing to give away discounts of up to ~Rs. 2.50 lakh on the base trim, which is the highest we have ever seen. So, the price hike was just a smoke screen when in reality, they are feeling the pinch from Mahindras BE6 and the Tata Curvv EV. We were counting on having a price war in the EV space in the 2025 - 28 period but a non-Chinese carmaker would take the first swing that, we didnt expect. The first swing will come from an Indian carmaker, that didnt just come as a surprise, it came as a shock. Its not this move that should scare the Chinese and even other carmakers. Its their attitude and hunger for greater market share, which should scare their rivals. The EV strategy suggests that this time around, they arent just going for one more bite out of the pie. They want the whole pie to themselves. Of course, it's not going to be easy but it looks like they are gunning for it anyway. That should make Hyundai very worried as they have maintained their hold on the 2nd spot in the Indian car market for God knows how long. Carmaker Jan 2025 Jan 2024 YoY% 12M Avg Maruti 1,73,599 1,66,802 +4.07% 1,46,850 Hyundai 54,003 57,013 -5.28% 50,193 Mahindra 50,659 43,068 +17.63% 44,950 Tata 48,075 53,635 -10.37% 46,409 Compared to Jan 2024, Mahindra and Maruti have gained market share while Hyundai and Tata have lost. Mahindra's YoY gains of 17.63% come across as enormous compared to Marutis. However, the YoY decline of 10.37% in Tatas sales suggests that they have graduated from 4th spot to 3rd. Since Hyundai also appear to have suffered some YoY decline in Jan 2025, its not too far-fetched to imagine that once Mahindra are feeling secure in the 3rd spot, they will be preparing to displace Hyundai from the 2nd spot. Mahindra XUV 3XO Report

Executive Summary

Overview.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compact SUV competing in a rapidly evolving market. This report analyzes the SUV segment, focusing on market dynamics, key features of the XUV 3XO, safety and luxury aspects, and sales performance. The SUV market is projected to reach $3.71 billion by 2033, with a CAGR of 2.5% from 2025. The XUV 3XO stands out with its design, features, and a recent 5-star Bharat NCAP safety rating. Sales data indicates a fluctuating trend with recent figures around 7,000 units per month.

This section provides an overview of the report's scope and key findings. It summarizes the market context and highlights the unique aspects of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • SUV market projected to reach $3.71B by 2033 with 2.5% CAGR.
  • Mahindra XUV 3XO: Key player in the compact SUV segment.
  • 5-star Bharat NCAP safety rating enhances market position.
  • Monthly sales around 7,000 units; fluctuating trends observed.

Mahindra XUV 3XO Features and Specifications.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants, including MX1, MX2, MX3, AX5, and AX7. Engine options include a 1.2L turbo-petrol, a 1.2L TGDi petrol, and a 1.5L diesel. The vehicle boasts features such as LED DRLs, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and Level 2 ADAS in higher variants. Safety features include 6 airbags and ESC.

This section details the specifications, variants, and key features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • Multiple variants: MX1, MX2, MX3, AX5, AX7.
  • Engine options: 1.2L turbo-petrol, 1.2L TGDi petrol, 1.5L diesel.
  • Features: LED DRLs, 10.25-inch touchscreen, Level 2 ADAS.
  • Safety: 6 airbags, ESC.
Variant Engine Key Features
MX1 1.2L Turbo Petrol 6 Airbags, ESC, Halogen Headlamps
MX2 1.5L Diesel 10.25-inch Touchscreen, Steering Controls
AX7 1.2L TGDi Petrol Level 2 ADAS, Skyroof, Premium Interiors

Safety Analysis.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has achieved a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests. It offers 35 standard safety features, including six airbags, ESC, ISOFIX child seat anchors, and a 360-degree camera. The vehicle scored 29.36 out of 32 in Adult Occupant Protection and 43 out of 49 in Child Occupant Protection.

This section presents a detailed analysis of the XUV 3XO's safety features and crash test performance.

  • 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP.
  • 35 standard safety features.
  • AOP: 29.36/32.
  • COP: 43/49.

Luxury Features and Comfort.

The XUV 3XO offers premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox, and a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system. It also features a panoramic sunroof (Skyroof) and smart connectivity with Amazon Alexa integration. These features provide a blend of comfort and technology.

This section details the luxury and comfort features available in the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • Premium leatherette seats
  • Cooled glovebox with illumination
  • Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system
  • Panoramic sunroof (Skyroof)
  • Smart connectivity with Amazon Alexa

Sales Data and Market Trends.

Mahindra XUV 3XO sales have shown some fluctuations, with recent monthly sales around 7,000 units. The SUV has contributed significantly to Mahindra's overall sales figures. Year-on-year growth has been observed in certain months, while month-on-month figures show variability.

This section analyzes the sales performance and market trends of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • Monthly sales around 7,000 units.
  • Year-on-year growth observed.
  • Fluctuating month-on-month sales.
  • Key contributor to Mahindra's sales.

Competitor Comparison.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO competes with models like Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, and Maruti Brezza. The XUV 3XO distinguishes itself with its blend of safety ratings, feature offerings, and engine options. In comparison, Tata Nexon offer slightly higher rating in AOP, but XUV 3XO offered the same level safety.

This section compares the Mahindra XUV 3XO with its key competitors in the compact SUV segment.

  • Competitors: Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Maruti Brezza
  • Key differentiators: Safety ratings, features, engine options
  • Strengths: Balance of safety and features
  • Compared to Tata Nexon, slightly lower AOP
